## The Glass Paperweight as a Multi-Layered Symbol

The glass paperweight is perhaps the most significant symbol in the novel, as it embodies all the literary aspects of the novel and combines the ideas and functions of all the other symbols.

### Connection to Beauty and the Past

Winston's attention is caught by its beauty when he purchases it for $4.00, and he is attracted "not so much its beauty as the air it seemed to possess an age quite different from the present one". The paperweight represents a time before the Party was in control, when freedom was easily attainable, and shows how "the party has abolished beauty for its own sake".

### Symbolism of the Coral and Relationship with Julia

Winston views the relationship with Julia as being like the coral, "fixed in a sort of eternity", with "the paperweight [as] the room he was in, and the coral was Julia's life and his own, fixed in a sort of eternity at the heart of the crystal". The coral inside the paperweight symbolizes love that Winston shares with Julia, a secret love hidden away from the rest of the world.

### Fragility as Foreshadowing

The fact that the paperweight is made out of glass reflects on the fragility of the relationship and foreshadows its destruction, portraying the fragility of the relationship due to the fact that it exists in a society devoid of such relations.(no content)The paperweight is a symbol of fragility, it represents Julia and Winston's relationship and of the destruction that will occur if they were to be caught – their little world can be shattered with ease by the Party and its followers.
